urls.description: Register your home or business in England, Scotland or Wales to receive flood warnings and find out how to check flood risk in Northern Ireland

tweets.text:
With more heavy rain forecast for the #Midlands tonight into tomorrow follow our steps to stay safe:

‚û°Ô∏èCheck your #flood risk: https://t.co/8HEpx2nkWv
‚û°Ô∏èSign up for flood alerts:
https://t.co/4G9UCfW5wr 
‚û°Ô∏èCall Floodline 0345 988 1188

‚ùå Never walk or drive through flood water https://t.co/Vv9CTLqsek

@agricontract @simoncclark456 @TomTierney18 @EnvAgency I‚Äôm not sure what you are hoping to gain from ignoring the issues of dredging? Acceptance from the echo-chamber of Twitter? Solutions to big problems like flooding rely on openness, understanding and willingness to change - let‚Äôs have a bit more of that please!

tweets.text: 16)In light of this the judge found that the Agency could and should have disregarded the June readings as they were abnormal outliers

10)So why? Well, on 12 June 2019 the Agency took samples of the water from the three beaches and found ‚Äòelevated levels of E-Coli and Intestinal Enterococci‚Äô. These are nasty and are caused by human or animal faeces.
8)In 2018 the @env agency classified water quality as ‚Äòexcellent‚Äô at three beaches in Lincolnshire ‚Äì Cleethorpes, Humberston Fitties and Ingoldmells South. Hurrah! https://t.co/PBBUzmOvPg
5)The latest version of the Directive, transposed to UK law, requires the @envagency to grade the water quality of bathing waters from ‚Äôexcellent‚Äô to ‚Äòpoor‚Äô
4)Rewind. After pressure from campaigners including @sascampaigns the EU passed the Bathing Water Directive https://t.co/W9kJcInRnh
@RobArden3 @simoncclark456 @TomTierney18 @EnvAgency Only issue from dredging is not starting down steam

urls.title: Roads in Leicestershire shut by floods - updates

tweets.text: The rain continues to cause problems https://t.co/fgjgHXNK59

With many #flood warnings in place across the #Midlands and more heavy rain on its way, make sure you stay #FloodAware

‚ö†Ô∏èCheck out the live flood warnings in your area https://t.co/4HSc5MbL20

‚ö†Ô∏èSteer clear of driving through flood water - just 30cm of water will float your car https://t.co/mEPTqoQWPO

Thanks to @EnvAgencyNW @AndynBrown16 for this video of River Alt at Lunt Meadows. 30 metres of embankment collapsed on Wednesday, saving Maghull from life threatening flooding. Big questions about whether to repair the breach or not as best way to protect against future flooding. https://t.co/noFY7D89n4

tweets.text:
Pleased I got a quick response from @Brent_Council after querying what actions they will look to take to resolve the situation at the #WelshHarp.

Discussions are ongoing between @CRTSouthEast/ @EnvAgency. To resolve this, all stakeholders must work together. @welshharpies https://t.co/pi2lizYtpD

With more rain expected to fall on already saturated ground overnight, we expect river levels in some of our upper river catchments to rise. Keep up to speed with the latest #flood info & sign up to receive flood warnings at https://t.co/OVBXgMyngb https://t.co/nUHvBSlOyX

‚ö†Ô∏è We're expecting to have to close Eckington Bridge within an hour due to flooding

@worcscc @Wychavon @EnvAgencyMids

@TruthSeekerTKS @GriffithStephen @RachaelMaskell @EnvAgencyYNE Do a little research and you will find dredging is the last thing they should do as it just makes water flow faster. Tree planting, beavers and flood plains upstream are all positive measures. Check out @slowtheflow_UK Pickering
@GSwinburn Wow!! That photo really puts it into perspective- force of that water must be intense

üì¢ Have you heard about our monthly bulletins in @angling_times? 

Its a great way of keeping up-to-date with the work of @NWFishEA and our fisheries teams across the country!

Catch up on December's edition here üëâhttps://t.co/HPRLIeTq7j

@Sacha4Dartford @EnvAgencySE @RiverMillSchool @Kent_cc @CleanerDartford @guardianeco @KentMessenger @TheSun @DefraGovUK @JonathonHawkes @Dartford_CA @Dartford_Labour @welovedartford Hi @Sacha4Dartford Central Road @RiverMillSchool I did mention this before.

@agricontract @simoncclark456 @TomTierney18 @EnvAgency So it sounds like you are doing good stuff on your farm, keeping soil on fields and out of rivers - if only others did the same! I‚Äôm not arguing that dredging wouldn‚Äôt get water away quicker it just shouldn‚Äôt be the focus as it comes with a lot of issues.

Im sick of flooding can the @EnvAgency please look at what the Dutch to control rain fall remember you used to be called the National rivers authority üò°
#ollyblogs #LockdownLearning  #OllyRants #flooding #farming https://t.co/109bZBoZ6S

@agricontract @maritime_fox @EnvAgency I am not saying that drainage is not important for ag land. But  there are strategies that slow the flow of water through the catchment, so you don't get the big pulse of water. One such strategy is what you do, with notill and cover crops. Good soil structure and infiltration.

@simoncclark456 @maritime_fox @EnvAgency Get off ya key board and pick up a spade 
With out drainage and drainage ditches the land fills up and stays full

Over 660 fires have been deliberately set by grouse moors on Yorkshire's peat hills since the government promised to ban burning in October 2018. üî•

üó£Ô∏è You can help put out the flames. Take action today: https://t.co/c4nNs9kROX https://t.co/o6WieKdTuC

Once again I am watching the Viking Recorder, @EnvAgencyYNE and currently it is saying that the Ouse will  rise to 3m tomorrow. The ground saturated. This is why I am meeting with the Minister next month again to highlight the need for upstream management.

Our @EnvAgencyNW Pump Team met with @johncurtinEA this morning at Didsbury Flood Storage Reservoir. We‚Äôve been pumping 24/7 reducing levels from 95% to <20% in less than a week. This will make sure we are ready for the next storm - hopefully not anytime soon!#TeamEA #PumpAction https://t.co/Lee4eSad2C
Flood warning remains in force for Norton, Malton and Old Malton https://t.co/VQwRk7zHam

Water levels in the River Derwent are still dropping, but 13cm of rain fell last night. So reassuring that pumps are still in place @NortonOnDerwent 
Thank-you @YorkshireWater @EnvAgencyYNE @RyedaleDC @KarenGazette @BBCYork @theyorkmix https://t.co/eDwWHH6oIs

urls.title: Anglian Pass being developed for boaters
urls.description: Boaters will have the option to purchase an 'Anglian Pass' which will allow them to navigate unrestricted across neighbouring navigations.

tweets.text:
Coming soonüö®

A new Anglian Pass for boaters in East Angliaüö§

This will allow boaters to move between different waterways without having to pay multiple registration fees. The price of the pass will cover this.

Read more: https://t.co/TYs3mmUigM #Boat #waterways

@SaveHoneyHill1 @CambridgeIndy @AnglianWater In yesterday‚Äôs press @CambridgeIndy report the Govt will allow @AnglianWater to fast-track ¬£300m for chalk streams project work @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyAnglia  @Feargal_Sharkey

Our new fish-friendly pumps in the ¬£35m refurbish of Keadby Pumping Station #Lincolnshire operated very well during #StormChristoph and also helped these eels migrate to spawning grounds. #fish #flood @UniOfHull 
https://t.co/HSnPk29obY https://t.co/Dj8t0NjvH1

Residents in Calderdale are being told to be prepared for potential flooding.
https://t.co/2GJ33KINbX

tweets.text: @johnnyrich @nocotu @Jennife15046404 @KwasiKwarteng @The_ONR @EnvAgency @theCCCuk The French state (who own EDF) won't rescue them, so why do UK govt want UK tax/billpayers to fund Sizewell C & take on the considerable build risk! 4 consultations over 8yrs pre DCO app & 1 after submission & EDF still don't have clear plans but use Covid-19 to their advantage

@RobArden3 @simoncclark456 @TomTierney18 @EnvAgency Closed really ! I am a no till cover crop farmer tell me what I can do but more importantly tell me what happens to Himalayan balsam grass reefs leaf fall etc when it dies on a river bank ?

The cosy relationship between the leadership of regulators and the boards of the industries that they regulate means nothing changes.

Do water companies offer cosy directorships to @EnvAgency directors as a bribe to stop them from doing their jobs? 

4/6 https://t.co/tUOvqnYCYD

Fines are where the (illegal) profits often hide! Any legitimate end use for this material must be sure of contamination levels or if going to landfill LOI %. Are you sure you know what happens to this ‚Å¶@EnvAgency‚Å© ‚Å¶@CrimestoppersUK‚Å© https://t.co/anrKKvHDve

Could beavers be a #NatureBasedSolution to attenuate flow in the StARR catchment?  New report supports principle: https://t.co/ZUZ3aU2xlJ  #NaturesEngineers @CornwallBeaver @CwallWildlife @WestcountryRT @CornwallCouncil @EnvAgencySW @UniofExeterESI @SouthWestWater https://t.co/8OSnswM9ob

Don't get me wrong.

Thank you @ab4scambs for doing all this to save our #chalkstreamsincrisis, thank you üôè

But regulation needs to be enforced. Licenses need to be revoked. @DefraGovUK @EnvAgency have teeth. They need to start using them.

6/6

Latest flood warnings and alerts for the Kent area can be found at https://t.co/8LZXh7vVvk
@EnvAgencySE

Appearing before the Public Accounts Committee on 14th Jan 2021 Sir James Bevan CEO of the @EnvAgency said "Almost by definition, we are not allowing people to discharge sewage into chalk streams".

Let's just check that statement shall we. https://t.co/tAAPJW9Wge
@RachaelMaskell @EnvAgencyYNE We really need thousands of appropriate trees to be planted upstream for everyone to benefit, not least the birds!

Astonished to learn that on 14 Jan @EnvAgency Chief Exec @JamesBevanEA told the Public Accounts Committee that "we are not allowing people to discharge sewage into chalk streams".

Did he intentionally mislead or does he not know that it happens? 

https://t.co/HW3zHY8zIP

@agricontract @simoncclark456 @TomTierney18 @EnvAgency Interested to know why you seem closed to different approaches to keeping excessive silt out of rivers and reducing peak flows? Is it because you don‚Äôt believe they work?

https://t.co/y52BjFUAok

The hidden world of #WasteCrime: metal theft. 

In this time of financial uncertainty, with the prices of metal rising, find out how the Joint Unit for Waste Crime is working to disrupt criminals who're damaging our economy through metal theft: https://t.co/aE4RW1iqU3 https://t.co/Ep8iTJEkpr
Just 30-centimetres of flowing water is enough to move your car. Please don't drive through #flood water #SafetyFirst #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/13GzbG2wYM

Last week, heavy rainfall from #StormChristoph caused #flooding across England.

Our staff have been working around the clock to keep the public and their homes safe.

There are still #FloodWarnings in place, so check your local flood risk now: https://t.co/X4IQl2YjjH https://t.co/YWbK4V6l3t

The old #Foss Barrier gate has been lifted out by crane today as we prepare for the new gate to be lifted into place tomorrow. This is part of our ¬£38m upgrade that will reduce #flood risk to 1,200 properties in #York https://t.co/M1nbHt3mIi
